# Create namespace and set context 

## 1 Create namespace development and production 
``` bash
kubectl create -f namespace_development.yaml
kubectl create -f namespace_production.yaml 
```

## 2 Set Context 
``` bash
kubectl config set-cluster JHR --server=https://10.10.100.179:6443
kubectl config set-context prod --namespace=production --cluster JHR 
kubectl config set-context dev --namespace=development --cluster JHR 

```
* kubectl config view
``` yaml
apiVersion: v1
clusters:
- cluster:
    certificate-authority-data: REDACTED
    server: https://10.10.100.179:6443
  name: JHR
- cluster:
    certificate-authority-data: REDACTED
    server: https://10.10.100.179:6443
  name: kubernetes
contexts:
- context:
    cluster: JHR
    namespace: development
    user: kubernetes-admin
  name: dev
- context:
    cluster: kubernetes
    user: kubernetes-admin
  name: kubernetes-admin@kubernetes
- context:
    cluster: JHR
    namespace: production
    user: kubernetes-admin
  name: prod
current-context: dev
kind: Config
preferences: {}
users:
- name: kubernetes-admin
  user:
    client-certificate-data: REDACTED
    client-key-data: REDACTED

```

* cat ~/.kube/config
``` yaml
apiVersion: v1
clusters:
- cluster:
    certificate-authority-data: 
    server: https://10.10.100.179:6443
  name: JHR
- cluster:
    certificate-authority-data: 
    server: https://10.10.100.179:6443
  name: kubernetes
contexts:
- context:
    cluster: JHR
    namespace: development
    user: kubernetes-admin
  name: dev
- context:
    cluster: kubernetes
    user: kubernetes-admin
  name: kubernetes-admin@kubernetes
- context:
    cluster: JHR
    namespace: production
    user: kubernetes-admin
  name: prod
current-context: dev
kind: Config
preferences: {}
users:
- name: kubernetes-admin
  user:
    client-certificate-data: 
    client-key-data: 

```

### use-context 
``` bash
kubectl config use-context dev 
kubectl config use-context prod
```
